newsitem.title: USA: Kansas feedlot cattle market thin at $68 - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Kansas feedlot cattle market thin at $68 - USDA.

text.p: Trade was moderate Wednesday morning, but turning quiet by the afternoon, USDA said.
Slaughter steers and heifers fully steady. Inquiry and demand moderate. Sales confirmed 3,400 slaughter steers and 3,000 slaughter heifers Wednesday.
For the week to date on 128,000 head confirmed including 21,400 head or about 17 percent previously contracted or formulated cattle and CME delivery cattle.
Sales FOB feedlot net weights after 4 percent shrink.
Slaughter steers - Select and Choice 2-3 1100-1250 lbs 68.00.
Slaughter heifers - Select and Choice 2-3 1000-1100 lbs 68.00.
Dressed basis - Select and Choice 2-3 1155 lbs 108.00, hot weights, delivered.
wk to date - 128,000 last week - 24,300 last year - 51,700
